questions.question: What is the proof or counterexample of the Riemann Hypothesis?
questions.source: Clay Mathematics Institute, Millennium Prize Problems, 2000
questions.notes: The Riemann Hypothesis concerns the zeros of the Riemann zeta function and their relation to the distribution of prime numbers.

questions.question: Can the Navier–Stokes equations be proven to always have smooth, globally defined solutions in three dimensions?
questions.source: Clay Mathematics Institute, Millennium Prize Problems, 2000
questions.notes: The problem involves proving existence and smoothness of solutions for 3D incompressible fluid flow.

questions.question: Is P equal to NP?
questions.source: Clay Mathematics Institute, Millennium Prize Problems, 2000
questions.notes: Asks whether problems whose solutions can be verified quickly can also be solved quickly.

questions.question: Does a smooth, simply connected, closed 4-manifold homeomorphic to the 4-sphere necessarily have a smooth structure equivalent to the standard one (Smooth Poincaré Conjecture in dimension 4)?
questions.source: Clay Mathematics Institute, Millennium Prize Problems, 2000
questions.notes: This is the Smooth Poincaré Conjecture in dimension four, still open.

questions.question: Can the existence and mass gap for Yang–Mills theories be rigorously established?
questions.source: Clay Mathematics Institute, Millennium Prize Problems, 2000
questions.notes: Shows whether non-abelian gauge theories have a mass gap.

questions.question: Is there a proof that the Hodge Conjecture holds for all non-singular projective algebraic varieties?
questions.source: Clay Mathematics Institute, Millennium Prize Problems, 2000
questions.notes: Relates to the characterization of certain classes in the cohomology of algebraic varieties.

questions.question: Does the Birch and Swinnerton-Dyer Conjecture hold for elliptic curves over rational numbers?
questions.source: Clay Mathematics Institute, Millennium Prize Problems, 2000
questions.notes: Links the number of rational solutions of an elliptic curve to the behavior of its L-function.

questions.question: Demo: What is the simplest demonstrable question with an answer?
questions.notes: A demo entry to show how answered questions render and provide an answer link.
